definition: to live high and look down (idiom)/to overlook/to tower above/to occupy the high ground/fig. arrogance based on one's social position
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Hummell:Your unit is covered from an elevated position, Commander. I'm not gonna ask yon again.
sentences.chinese: 咱们居高临下，中校，我不想再重复了。

sentences.english: Now that he is rich,he talks down to his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他现在富了，竟然以居高临下的口气对朋友们讲话。

sentences.english: The windows of the house stared bleakly down at her.
sentences.chinese: 那座房子的窗户居高临下阴森森地对着她。

sentences.english: I often condescending, disdain for everything, gesticulating at home.
sentences.chinese: 我常常居高临下，傲视一切，在家里指手划脚。

sentences.english: Our garden is overlooked from the neighbour's balcony.
sentences.chinese: 从邻居的阳台居高临下可以俯视我家的花园。

sentences.english: Many buildings built in the Mid- Levels golf, occupy a commanding position in a momentum.
sentences.chinese: 许多建筑建在半山坡上，有一种居高临下的气势。

sentences.english: This position clear at a glance down the entire river.
sentences.chinese: 这个位置居高临下整个江面一目了然。

sentences.english: He said patronizingly, "This picture is budgeted at five million."
sentences.chinese: 他居高临下地说，“这部电影的预算是五百万美元。”

sentences.english: Majestic simplicity, condescending , overlooking the entire Temple, the main temple building.
sentences.chinese: 雄伟古朴，居高临下，俯瞰全寺，为寺内主要建筑。

definition: to tilt one's head back to see (sth)/to look up at
to look disdainfully out of the corner of one's eye
Gaotai county in Zhangye 張掖|张掖[Zhang1 ye4], Gansu
